Test.Name: Correct response (DisableAccessPoint is not supported)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns AccessPointInfo with DisableAccessPoint=false

Test.Name: Correct response with one token (Enable/Disable)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns correct response with one token with DisableAccessPoint=true. Switching from Enable to Disable.

Test.Name: Correct response with one token (Disable/Enable)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns correct response with more than one token with DisableAccessPoint=true. Switching from Disable to Enable.

Test.Name: Correct response (DisableAccessPoint supported only for some AccessPointInfo)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns correct response, DisableAccessPoint supported only for some AccessPointInfo

Test.Name: Correct response with more than one token
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns correct response with more than one token with DisableAccessPoint=true.

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
ACCESSCONTROL-2-1-8 ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT
STEP 1 - Get PACS service address Transmit done Receive done http://localhost:3246/onvif/ServicePACS11/PACSService.asmx STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Get Service Capabilities Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 3 - Check that the DUT returned service capabilities STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Get AccessPointInfo list Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Check that result is not null STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Check that capabilities are present for AccessPoint 'tokenAccessPoint1' STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Enable AccessPoint with token='tokenAccessPoint1' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 8 - Get AccessPointInfo for token='tokenAccessPoint1' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Check that AccessPoint 'tokenAccessPoint1' is enabled STEP PASSED
STEP 10 - Disable AccessPoint with token='tokenAccessPoint1' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 11 - Get AccessPointInfo for token='tokenAccessPoint1' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 12 - Check that AccessPoint 'tokenAccessPoint1' is disabled STEP PASSED
STEP 13 - Check that capabilities are present for AccessPoint 'tokenAccessPoint2' STEP PASSED
STEP 14 - Disable AccessPoint with token='tokenAccessPoint2' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 15 - Get AccessPointInfo for token='tokenAccessPoint2' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 16 - Check that AccessPoint 'tokenAccessPoint2' is disabled STEP PASSED
STEP 17 - Enable AccessPoint with token='tokenAccessPoint2' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 18 - Get AccessPointInfo for token='tokenAccessPoint2' Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 19 - Check that AccessPoint 'tokenAccessPoint2' is enabled STEP PASSED
TEST PASSED

Test.Name: NoResponse (DisableAccessPoint)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns no response on DisableAccessPoint request

Test.Name: Fault (DisableAccessPoint)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns fault on DisableAccessPoint request

Test.Name: NoResponse (EnableAccessPoint)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns no response on EnableAccessPoint request.

Test.Name: Fault (EnableAccessPoint)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns fault on EnableAccessPoint request.

Test.Name: Correct response with more than one token (MaxLimit=number of AccessPoint)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns correct response with more than one token with DisableAccessPoint=true.

Test.Name: Correct response with more than one token (MaxLimit is less than number of AccessPoint)
Test.Description: Check ENABLE/DISABLE ACCESS POINT test when DUT returns correct response with more than one token with DisableAccessPoint=true.
